turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Petra Diamonds.
turn.1: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.2: The mine is also famed for its pink diamonds.
turn.3: Why is it famed for its pink diamonds?
turn.4: In 1947, the mine's founder Dr. John Williamson presented Princess Elizabeth (later Elizabeth II) with a flawless pink diamond (the Williamson Pink Diamond) on her wedding day.
turn.5: Is there anything else noteable about the diamonds?
turn.6: The eventual cut diamond became the centre stone in the Williamson Diamond brooch and is supposedly the basis for the Pink Panther diamond in the film of the same name.
turn.7: What other diamonds did they find?
turn.8: The Williamson Mine currently has a resource of 39.6 million carats (8,000 kg) (984 million tonnes of kimberlite).
turn.9: Is there anything else interesting about the diamonds?
turn.10: It has an average mining depth of 65 metres (90m at the deepest point) and a very low stripping ratio.
turn.11: Is there anything else diamond related?
turn.12: Energy and Minerals Minister William Ngeleja said Petra's entry is "an opportunity to breathe new life into Williamson Mine and Tanzania's diamond mining sector." Petra commenced exploration in Botswana, following the acquisition of Kalahari Diamonds in September 2005. Petra Diamonds Botswana is the holder of approximately 21,519 km of diamond exploration ground, all of which is "on craton" (the geological formation known to host diamonds).
